page.title: 19Ordnance Factory_Newtown
page.content: The Ordnance Factory began to run down in 1943_44 and at the end of the war it was moved to a more convenient site.This left an area of unsightly factory buildings and derelict land. In the 1970s planners began to clear the site.Only four of the twenty bunkers were retained,the rest were demolished.Houses,shops,factories,road s,schools were built.A nature reserve was created,parks were laid out around and among the houses,hundreds of trees were planted along the roads.Now it is impossible to visualise the former dereliction and the ordnance factory of the 1940s is only recalled in some of the street names:Ordnance Avenue, Admirals Road.One of the bunkers is scheduled to become a World War 2 Museum.The bunkers prove a tourist attraction to visitors wishing to take a trip into the past.
